messages.title: The NHS is there to look after us when we need it. Now, we must look after it. Vote for your NHS.
messages.content: Doctors are leaving our hospitals. NHS vacancies have risen to over 100,000. This puts patients at risk, in spite of the best efforts of an overstretched and underpaid NHS workforce who have not had a real pay rise in years. Now the Tories have instructed their candidates to refuse to sign pledges promising not to privatise the NHS or to include it in any trade deal. Why? Because President Trump has already stated that everything, including our NHS, would be on the table in any negotiations. A vote for Labour is a vote to stop our NHS being sold off to the highest bidder. Mohammad Yasin and Labour believe that the NHS works best when it is run for patients and not for profit. Labour has a plan to save our NHS and improve healthcare in the UK. We will fully fund our NHS and reverse all traces of privatisation form it. We will reintroduce the nursing bursary and increase GP training places so that there are more life-saving staff to reduce the pressures on our NHS. We will end the scourge of prescription fees, making sure that nobody is ever again prevented from accessing the treatment they need.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will expand the number of GP training places by 1,500 a year to cut waiting times. Mohammad Yasin will also fight for inpatient mental health beds in Bedford.
Provide the resources the police need to keep us safe. Under the Tories our county has seen the highest percentage increase in violent crime in England.
Labour will support a referendum on any Brexit deal, with 'remain' being on the ballot paper. You should have the final say on Brexit.
Labour will intervene to deliver a green industrial revolution, creating hundreds of thousands of green jobs.
Provide free personal care for elderly people, and restore free TV licenses for all over 75. Support the WASPI women who have been let down by the Tories.

images.caption: Mohammad Yasin, your Labour candidate outside Bedford Hospital.
